age: Not specifically stated (likely in his mid-to-late adulthood)
description: An aristocratic and provocative thinker whose witty epigrams and cynical philosophies captivate and influence those around him, particularly Dorian. Lord Henry promotes a life of aesthetic indulgence and intellectual daring.
personality: Charismatic, ironic, and hedonistic, Lord Henry exudes confidence and intellectual playfulness. His conversations brim with paradoxes and epigrams that both charm and unsettle, reflecting a man who delights in the manipulation of ideas and the subversion of conventional morality.
voice: Eloquent and smooth with a distinctive, teasing lilt. His accent and phrasing likely reflect his upper-class background, delivering his ironic insights with a relaxed, almost nonchalant, yet mesmerizing cadence.
appearance: Immaculately dressed in fashionable evening wear that underscores his aristocratic flair. Although detailed physical descriptions are sparse in this chapter, his overall bearing suggests a well-groomed and refined gentleman, whose style is as carefully curated as his conversational wit.
